noun.description: A silvery-white metal, the chemical element of atomic number 28.

examples: a button the size of a nickel
we will see gasoline prices go up about a nickel

origin: Mid 18th century: shortening of German Kupfernickel, the copper-colored ore from which nickel was first obtained, from Kupfer copper + Nickel demon (with reference to the ore's failure to yield copper).
